tuning_strategy.selection_rationale: Under sparse participation and long local blocks, client drift is dominated by how many clients aggregate per round (client_frac) and the length of local training between synchronizations (local_steps); the projection dimension (subspace_ratio r/d) in SFedAvg governs how much of the update is filtered, directly affecting stability versus speed.

configs.rationale: Strong projection (smaller r/d) with baseline sparse participation and long blocks to maximally damp drift.
Scenario’s baseline r/d; tests whether moderate projection suffices to stabilize high drift.
Larger r/d closer to momentum SGD; probes potential speed gains versus reduced projection benefits under extreme drift.
Even sparser participation to stress drift; evaluates projection’s robustness as aggregation variance increases.
More clients per round to reduce variance; checks if increased averaging compensates long local blocks.
Longer local blocks further increase drift; assesses whether projection prevents oscillations.
Shorter local blocks reduce drift; compares stability improvements without changing participation.
Strong projection with more clients but very long blocks; tests trade-off between filtering, averaging, and drift.

tuning_strategy.expected_improvement: We expect SFedAvg to deliver smoother and faster convergence at r/d≈0.10–0.15 with client_frac≥0.05, while too small r/d (0.05) may slow progress but maximize stability; reducing local_steps (to ~15) or increasing client_frac (to ~0.10) should lower drift and variance, yielding lower loss and higher accuracy than FedAvg under the same sparse-participation conditions.
